Marcus Benjamin
Writer. Superhero. Smart Ass Extraordinaire.
Mar 7

Ten Other Things Jason Chaffetz Wants You To Give Up In Exchange For Healthare

Jason Chaffetz Has Opened Our Eyes

Jason Chaffetz really did it this time didn’t he? And by it, I mean he put his foot so far down your throat, he’ll be coughing up leather for months. Telling low-income citizens they’ll have to make “sacrifices” and “hard choices” for healthcare is one thing, but then he said, “Maybe, rather than getting that new iPhone that they just love and they want to spend hundreds of dollars on, maybe they should invest in their own healthcare.”

He said the quiet part loud and the loud part quiet. Yeah, he walked it back, but he shouldn’t get credit for doing what anyone with a brain can do. We here at Still Crew are nothing if not helpful, so here’s our list of other things that would give us all pause if forced to pick them over healthcare. Because, ya know, we don’t know any better.

  1. College Education or Healthcare

This is a tough one. The cost of both can be crazy but have you seen those tuition bills? Well obviously he hasn’t but at least he’s trying to make it more affordable for people like uswho believed the lie that journalism would pay the bills. Oh…wait…he’s not trying to lower the costs of college and lower interest rates on tuition payments? Well damn. At least someone had the audacity to attempt to make healthcare more affordable, starting with the belief that Americans should have the same healthcare costs and coverage that you get.

If I don’t pay those universities what they’re owed, I’ll get stressed out which will no doubt lead to bad health. But if I don’t have health insurance, who’s going to help me when we have a stroke or stomach ulcer? Decisions, decisions. — Marcus Benjamin

2. A Clean Bottle Of Water In Flint, Michigan or Healthcare
It’s 2017 and Flint still doesn’t have clean drinking water. It’s hard to imagine that residents will truly be torn between snagging a new iPhone and prioritizing healthcare, as Jason Chaffetz, bumbling buffoon that he is, assumed. No, under the GOP’s plan Flint residents will be tasked with either buying healthcare or clean-drinking water.

It’s sort of a catch-22 when you think about it: Do Flint citizens buy healthcare to help them overcome the ailments of imbibing tainted Flint River water for years or actual freakin’ water — one of the building blocks of life? At approximately $107 for 11 cases of Nestle H20 at Wal-Mart (based off this blog post about how much bottled water a family would need), it seems like this costly purchase for what should be an inalienable right takes precedence. To be fair, it’s kind of pointless to sweat not having health insurance when you’re dead. — Ryan Joseph

3. Tha Carter V or Healthcare
This could’ve been number 1 and for a lot of people, it will be. The Carter V is the white whale in Hip-Hop right now. Wayne may be getting his Ahab on, chasing it no matter the costs, but we’re all engrossed by the drama and want to see the fruits of his labor. When it comes to picking a long-awaited album from one of the best to ever do it or taking care of that little twinge in your back, what do you do? Tha Carter V could potentially represent the end of an era, closing Wayne’s chapter of the Cash Money Records story. So what if your limbs are aching, your eyes are bloodshot, and your chest feels like a Wile E. Coyote anvil is sitting on it, but that Carter V though.

Plus Wayne has money and more importantly, knows how to get it. Therefore if I listen to Wayne, I too we’ll know how to get money and won’t have to make this King Solomon-esque choice of yours. If you have to decide between going “Wobble-dy Wobble-dy” and dropping it like it’s hot or just plain dropping, you know what to do. — Marcus Benjamin

4. Punching Jason Chaffetz Square in the Face or Healthcare.
This is exactly what I wanted to do after hearing Chaffetz pose this dilemma to low-income Americans. Then I wondered, if I actually faced the choice of being insured or getting a free swing at this dirtball, which would I choose? On one hand, I’m not getting any younger and this bum ankle isn’t healing itself from my recent climbing spill. On the other, I’d like nothing more than to play Brennan Huff opposite Rep. Chaffetz’s Derek in a reenactment of the tree house scene in Stepbrothers. Because you know what’s always good for shoulder pain? — ced.

5. Guac on my Chipotle or Healthcare
Nothing boosts my ego more than waving away a Chipotle employee when they ask me if it’s okay that guac is extra. I imagine this is what Diddy feels like whenever he picks up a bar tab for his entourage. Yes, I know it’s extra, and, yes, I’m getting it every damn time I’m in the building. Even though it transforms my lunch into a two-figure investment, I have a reputation in the streets to maintain. At this point in my life, I’ve probably spent American Health Care Act numbers on Chipotle’s green gold. But will I start foregoing guac on my chicken bowls in lieu of health coverage and the cholesterol pills I’ll eventually need from this diet? Why can’t I have both? — ced.

6. Ten Shares of SNAP or Healthcare
I know you saw the market the day Snapchat announced their IPO. Look at all the damn money they made. This Catholic school in Cali invested $15,000 five years ago and as of five days ago, his investment is worth seven times the initial value. Seven. Times. I’m terrible at math so I won’t even front like I can give you the actual value, but I know it’s a pretty big number with several commas and lots of zeroes.

If I could have just 10 shares of that, I wouldn’t even need your crummy healthcare plan. I’d be able to afford whatever plan I wanted with cash leftover because like most things in this country, it would then favor the super rich. Which is what I’d be with just ten shares of SNAP. Super Rich Man. I could even afford to reinstall phone booths so I could change into my costume and thwart bad guys with my Scrooge McDuck paper. — Marcus Benjamin

7. One Night With An Instagram Model or Healthcare
As any man will tell you, the true epidemic in our society is the thirst trap. It strikes hard, then fades into the night until there’s nothing left but regret and unfortunate DMs. But if you could have one night with one of these beautiful women — just one — wouldn’t that be worth picking over whatever eventually replaces the Affordable Care Act? You can always go to a doctor to get that thing on your junk looked at and you only do live once. The problem here is that both of you would probably need healthcare after that one night, so it’s what they call, a catch-22. Emphasis on catch. — Marcus Benjamin

8. Ad-Free Hulu or Healthcare
Without fail, I’ll be in the middle of watching 24: Legacy or The Mindy Project and then I get a commercial. If I could live in a world where that doesn’t exist, that would do wonders for my mental health. But is healthcare more important than that? Is that extra $4.00 worth more than talking to a therapist to deal with my mental health the proper way rather than burying my sorrows in Empire marathon sessions? The therapist is cool and all, but Empire has Cookie. — Marcus Benjamin

9. Nike/Adidas/Retro Jordans or Healthcare
Talk about a real Sophie’s choice. I mean, do I need to say anymore than this? — Marcus Benjamin

10. Food or Healthcare
Does one want to survive with the proper vitamins and nutrients or starve to death in order to pay for a doctor who will then proceed to tell them how they need to eat? Quite the pickle, which coincidentally, would not be afforded to you in this situation if you choose healthcare. — Marcus Benjamin

Please recommend the article if you enjoyed it. Be sure to follow us on Twitter, @WeAreStillCrew.
